device_mount: Handheld; Placed loosely around user (e.g., table)
scale: Room; Social space; Near, personal space
devices_included: Any screen device; Phone; Tablet; Laptop; Desktop computer
use_cases_desc:
Not directly use cases, but possibilities for improving multi-device management:
- synchronization
- minimizing overhead
- overview of resources
- better sharing of resources (adhoc)
- augmenting existing routines
contribution_desc: Study of multi-device use in the workplace. Identified friction in primarily two areas: phusical handling of devices and cross-device synchronization.
interaction_techniques: Ask for better strategies for multi-device MANAGEMENT
crossdevice_def:
Focus on "multi-device management".

"We use the term multi-device management to refer to all actions oriented toward one's set of information devices, implemented with the purpose of securing the preconditions for work. HCI research addressing the problem of multiple devices is only beginning to emerge. "
